author: washingtonpost.com
title: Overwhelmingly adverbial writing
text:
October 9 at 7:43 PM Charles Krauthammer has done it again. No, not the usual rant against President Obama, but in his Sept. 25 op-ed column, “ Campaign double suicide ,” Krauthammer unleashed a torrent of adverbs: “cynically pander,” “sincerely felt,” “morally outrageous,” “politically poisonous,” “certainly damaging,” “denigrates, however thoughtlessly.” All these in one paragraph. Then, “knowingly lurching,” “marching inexorably,” “flamboyantly shooting” and “gratuitously alienating.”
Young readers or aspiring writers, beware: Adverbs are questionable substitutes for passion and may impinge on good writing.
Martin Lowenkopf , Bethesda
